sn22.151:1.2: Kiṁ upādāya might be rendered as “derived from what”, but the fact that it is parallel with abhinivissa (“insist”) shows that the sense “grasping” is prominent. Grasping is the “taking up” of the view of self, which hardens into “insistence”.
sn22.151:1.5: This is another context that emphasizes the “existence” of the aggregates (see SN 22.94:1.5 and note).
